definition: to thank/to apologize/to wither (of flowers, leaves etc)/to decline
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: The dry river – bed finds no thanks for its past.
sentences.chinese: 枯竭的河牀覺得無需向豐水期表示謝意。
對於您的邀請我們深表謝意。

sentences.english: Please convey my gratitude to her.
Let us assure you that we received the gift with profound gratitude.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們再次爲收到了的禮物深表謝意。

sentences.english: No one deserves a bigger thank you than you.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人比您更值得如此深厚的謝意。

sentences.english: I would like to express our gratitude on behalf of the Kindergarten for your patronage.
sentences.chinese: 僅此向你表達我校仝人無盡的謝意。

sentences.english: My sincere thanks to you, wish you happy in the beautiful, often remain.
sentences.chinese: 對你表示真摯的謝意，願您美麗常在，幸福常存。

sentences.english: This is Teache' Day and a time to be grateful to all teache.
sentences.chinese: 時逢西席節，是向全體西席表達謝意的日子。

sentences.english: These flowers are a small acknowledgement of your great kindness.
sentences.chinese: 這些花是用來對您的恩惠略表謝意的。

sentences.english: Thank you in anticipation for any information you may be able to give us.
sentences.chinese: 對你方提供的信息在此先表謝意。

sentences.english: I have a small token of our gratitude which I would like you to have.
sentences.chinese: 我有一點小禮物表達我們的謝意，請你接受。

sentences.english: I earnestly thank the project team with their best effort done.
sentences.chinese: 在此，並對專案小組的努力表達誠摯的謝意。

sentences.english: Please take my gratitude to other interviewers.
sentences.chinese: 請轉達我對其他面試人員的謝意。

sentences.english: And the sheriff thanked the suspect.
sentences.chinese: 司法官對嫌疑人表達了謝意。

sentences.english: This is a time to be grateful to all teachers.
sentences.chinese: 時逢所有教師表達謝意的時候。

sentences.english: When class was over, Amy went up to teacher to thank her for her help.
sentences.chinese: 下課時，艾米來到老師跟前對她的幫助表示謝意。

definition: expression of gratitude/to give thanks/a thank-you note/acknowledgement
to express sympathy, greetings, consolation etc
to praise/to approve of/to show approval
to admire/to look up to/to respect sb greatly
to trust/to have confidence in/to have faith in/to rely on
to repay a favor/to give back/feedback
to offer respectfully/to consecrate/to dedicate/to devote
